thread.title: How rival gangs orchestrated Melbourne chaos
thread.title_full: How rival gangs orchestrated Melbourne chaos

title: How rival gangs orchestrated Melbourne chaos
text:
Police knew for weeks gangs planned to riot at White Night February 20, 2017 8:11am Image AU VIC: Police Address Public After Melbourne White Night Brawl February 19 10:23 
Victoria Police ?stood in-between groups that looked like they were going to flare up? during the annual White Night event in Melbourne on Saturday, February 18. Speaking to the media on Sunday, February 19, Detective Sergeant David Woolfe of the Armed Crime Squad said ?We did have some issues in regard to a number of young people who had come into the city to cause trouble. We were well aware of that issue occurring and likely to occur.? More than 20 people were arrested in a ?picture prefect operation.? Credit: Victoria Police via Storyful February 19th 2017 18 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/ A gang of youths clash with police, one is found with a baseball bat after police broke up a confrontation with another group. Picture: Jason Edwards Aneeka Simonis AAP Share on Twitter 
POLICE say they knew for weeks of plans by two youth gangs to cause havoc at Melbourne’s White Night event. 
Assistant Commissioner Stephen Leane told reporters that officers had intelligence the groups would meet in the city and cause trouble well before the night. 
In turn, police had formulated a “well planned” response to any threat of violence. 
“A lot of (social media) sites aren’t locked so police have become adept at (monitoring them),” Mr Leane said. Police break up gangs during the White Night event in Melbourne. Picture: Jason Edwards Source: News Corp Australia Police confiscate baseball bats from youths at White Night. Picture: Jason Edwards Source: News Corp Australia 
Officers used pepper spray to break up a rowdy confrontation between two youth groups at Federation Square about 1am on Sunday. 
Mr Leane said those involved were aged between 14 and 19 and had been discussing the face-off for weeks, including via social media. 
“As far as we can see it’s the United Nations of groups. They merge but they take a dislike to each other and for some reason the groups were deciding last night they’d have a go,” he said. Police are forming a wall. There are hundreds here. @theheraldsun pic.twitter.com/IMoHreY3MC — Brianna Travers (@briannatravers) February 18, 2017 
Hundreds of police swarmed the area, including members of the mounted branch and public response order unit, standing between the opposing groups who “looked like they were going to flare up”, according to Mr Leane. 
Asked if he thought the trouble was linked to the Apex gang, which disrupted last year’s Moomba parade, he said, “I’m not sure if Apex even still exists.” 
Instead, he described the potential participants as “networked” offenders. Police arrest a man at the White Night event in Melbourne. Picture: Jason Edwards Source: News Corp Australia 
More than 20 arrests were made over the course of the night, including at Footscray train station where police found youths in possession of a can of OC spray. 
Other weapons including knives and knuckle dusters were also seized. 
About 500,000 people attended the annual White Night event and authorities say they were pleased overall with behaviour on the night.
